name: welcome
label: Hello, PSA On-Farm Team.  Is this your first time doing decomp bags?

name: note1
label: You will be distributed barcodes for your field sites.  24 barcodes per site. Barcodes read as follows: SITE-Subplot-Row-Timepoint example: CCC-1-A-3.  Subplot = 1 or 2, Row = A or B, and Time = T0 to T5  = 6 time points.

name: note2
label: This Kobo form has enough spaces 1 Farm: for 24 Decomp bag Pre-weights.  To continue, you will need: 24 Barcodes for 1 farm site, 20 Mesh Bags (1 mm mesh bags 26cm x 60 cm) with metal tags and 4 Large Paper Bags

name: note3
label: Using a metal tag, Attach 20 barcodes for T1 to T5 onto the mesh bags and stick 4 barcodes for T0 onto the paper bags. IMPORTANT - NEVER use T0 barcodes on the Mesh Bags. Use only paper bags for T0.  Those do not remain in the field.

name: note4
label: All pre-weights include the tags and labels.

name: note5
label: Note about weighing:  This pre-weight should be to at least 1 decimal place (2 is better), using the same scale, or very similar (ie: decimal point accuracy, model, calibration, etc) that you will use for the fresh weight and dry weight of the same bag later on in the process.
